fields.description:
I'm having trouble coming up with a reduced test case for this one.

Create a page with the following content (not the ----)

----
This is the home page for the My Test Space space.

You can edit the content of this page with the Edit link on the right. I'm just creating lots of different versions here.

Moo

HTML Edit!
----

Update it to this:

----
This is the home page for the My Test Space space.

You can edit the content of this page with the Edit link on the right. I'm just creating lots of different versions here.

Plain-text edit!

Moo

HTML Edit!
----

So it will be easy to generate ready-to-use static websites with the content of a space. 
With this kind of feature, Confluence could be used as a simple and but powerful CMS.

fields.description:
When you delete a child page, the {children} macro for its parent becomes unfunctional.  Instead of the list of child pages, you get an error message highlighted in pink:

children: Hibernate lazy instantiation problem

Reproduction steps:
1. Create a page
2. Create a child page (i did this both by the Create Child Page link, and by creating a link first, clicking on it to make the page, and assigning the parent page by hand)
3. Remove the child page by the remove link on the page actions
4. On the parent page, add a {children} macro.
5. The parent page will produce the above error message.

Note that this happens whether the macro is present before the child page is deleted or not.  This bug propagates upwards, such that a grandparent page will show a list of its direct children, but the child with its own child missing will show the Hibernate error.
fields.summary: {children} macro barfs on removed child page

fields.description:
If a user goes to http://confluence.atlassian.com/ they are deposited on the dashboard screen, which is really useful for regular users but confusing as hell for random visitors (and not really good as a site homepage). It would be much better if they started on CONFDOC:Home

Site Administrator should be able to assign a "Site homepage" from a drop-down menu including the dashboard, and the homepages of each space that allows anonymous access. Anonymous users going to the site root will get the homepage, logged in users will get the dashboard.

If privileges are changed to make the site homepage not accessible to anonymous users, this config should be automagically reverted to the dashboard.
fields.summary: Set "Site Homepage"

Right now, anonymous edits/comments are marked with no author information at all. Ideally, they should be clearly marked as being anonymous.

We should also store the source IP address of any anonymous changes. (Or possibly all changes)
fields.summary: Better handling of anonymous contributions

fields.description:
I've been trying to use Confluence since the first alpha, but it crashes when I do the simplest things.

I noticed in 1.0b1 that the exception reporter has been improved.  It organizes some important information and gives an e-mail address to which to submit the report.

If people are going to put their data in this, reliability is priority 1.  I'd much rather have Confluence stop crashing than any new feature.

But here's my idea for a feature that will help: a very simple crash submission mechanism.  Think Netscape Talkback or Windows Error Reporter (whatever it's called).  You've already got a page to explain what to do.  Why not put a link on there that submits to Atlassian the stack trace and the server log.  What would be really great is if you could auto-populate a JIRA issue and let the user add more details.  Even if you send a simple e-mail, you could leave a box for the user to explain what they were attempting.
fields.summary: One-click bug submission

Just my 0.02$...

fields.description:
External links should have a title attribute to say that clicking on them will leave the space.  

Internal links should have a title attribute explaining what clicking them does (either create page, or view page).

External links should be aggregated on the right hand side of the page, like 'references'.  See slashdot articles for examples of this.

Cheers,
Scott

I think users demo-ing our app will find this pretty annoying. :)

fields.summary: Export space fails

fields.description:
Current space permissions:

1) View - can view space, comment, edit and remove pages
2) Add page - can add pages to the space
3) Administer

New permissions scheme:

1) View - can look at the space
2) Comment - can leave comments
3) Edit - can add, edit and remove pages, delete comments
4) Administer
fields.summary: Change Space Permissions

fields.description: In the current dev version, previous versions seem to be listed in the wrong order?
fields.summary: Previous Versions are listed in wrong order

fields.description: We're using 2.0 but 2.0.1 has some speed improvements, we should update.
fields.summary: Upgrade to SiteMesh 2.0.1

fields.description:
We need this to:
- handle Word curly quotes conversion
- add proxy-no cache headers to responses
- set request encoding
fields.summary: Steal EncodingFilter from JIRA

fields.description:
When the user logs in, we record their login date. When they login again, we record their 'last login date' (ie their previous login date) and then their 'current login date'). Now we provide a report (just link it from the reports on the dashboard for now) that shows all pages that were modified between their last.login.date and now, in spaces that they can see obviously.

Similarly, if they're viewing a page - and that page has a modification date > the user's last login date - provide a special link on the right that says 'Show changes since my last login' - which sends them to the 'diff date X vs now' action.

Also, we should modify pagelist.vm (the component for listing pages) to display in red pages which are modified since your last login, and green for new since your last login, otherwise normal. Same for spaces too. And it applies to everywhere we show a list of pages or spaces.

PS: we should cache the users last login date in their session to make lookup faster.
fields.summary: Show pages and spaces changed or added since last login

fields.description:
1. Make a page link from one space to another (e.g. from Home page of an space to non-home page of another space).
2. Go to the link destination page
3. Go for "Page Information" there
4. You'll see that the incoming link is not correctly listed there as the Space Key is totally ignored! and the link source is actually pointing to  a page within the 'current' space!
fields.summary: Incoming links from other spaces are not listed in 'Page Information'!

fields.description: It's possible to delete the last user with administrate-confluence privileges.
fields.summary: Possible to delete last admin user

fields.description: the drop tables command on the hibernate Export schema isn't working since the HibernateConfluenceSetup was removed. As we do not use the drop table command, this isn't a high priority, but it is useful for testing. Will need to fix the TestSchemaHelper too.
fields.summary: With the current Hibernate configuration dropping tables using ExportSchema tool doesn't work

fields.description: We should upgrade our filter to the one in Spring, I think it's more resource efficient and it won't force us to have a transaction for _every_ request as we do now.
fields.summary: Upgrade to the Spring SessionInView filter

fields.description:
When you create a child page, there's no obvious sign it's there unless you edit the parent page to put in the {children} macro. If I hadn't just been reading the backlog of Jira updates, I'd have been confused as to what had really happened in creating the child. Where'd it go?

Perhaps there should be a "this page has children" icon by the page title, which when clicked launches a popup that lists the children. This way the children would always be available somehow, even in the absence of the children macro.

Alternatively, when a page's first child is created, if it doesn't already have a {children} macro in the page, confluence should insert one at the end like thus:

h2. Child Pages
{children}

The assumption being that in creating a child, the user wants it listed _somewhere_.
fields.summary: Child pages invisible by default

fields.description:
When creating a space called "foo&bar", this is displayed as foo&Amp;bar in the page list. Although the page is there, visible and reachable it is shown as orphaned page. Furthermore, the page has no incoming links when viewing page information.

It seems that URL-en/decoding is inconsistent as some point.
fields.summary: & (&Amp;) in Space name breaks link tracking

fields.description:
Displays
- build stats
- JVM stats
- web container stats
- uptime stats

This information can be reused on the custom 500 error page
fields.summary: View System Information Page (like JIRA's)

fields.description: We should show both 'add page' and 'add child page' links when viewing a given page.
fields.summary: When viewing a page, show 'add child page' link

fields.description:
Add a {children} macro to display the children of a page.

Usages:
{children} - show the direct children as bulleted list

{children:all=true} - show all the descendents of this page as a hierarchical list (tree)

{children:depth=X} - show the descendents of this page to a depth of X (1 = direct descendents, 2 = children and grand children etc, 0 will show all descendents)
fields.summary: Macro: {children}

fields.description:
Currently the confluence.domain property is excluded from external referrrers.

The problem is often a web app has multiple ways to get to it (ie localhost and 192.168.0.90), so we need to be able to add more 'excluded prefixes'.

I suggest storing them in a setup property.

They should be edited on the General Configuration screen. Let's use a text area and specify one prefix per line.
fields.summary: Add 'external referrer exclude prefixes'

fields.description:
Created a template containing

Owen is the best every @NICE THING@
I also really like @NICE THING@
and another @NICETHING@

The variables with spaces are not variables.  It should atleast say this in the doco.

Also could not see where to specify space specific template, but the i only have one space.
fields.summary: Template variables can not have spaces.

fields.description:
Look at a page called Another page this has !@#$%^&*() characters

and clicked on the link to itself in the top bar.
Then went to the referres page which listed itself as a referrer.

The renamed the page and the referrer was still the so i clicked on it and got the following error.

The following error(s) occurred: 
You must enter a value for title.

This should atleast know if it is coming from somewhere that might not know if that page exists anymore.

Best solution and probably very difficult is to know internal urls and remove the from referrers if the no longer exist.
fields.summary: Referrers does take into account renamed pages.

fields.description:
It would be useful to have a popup inserter for inserting tables.

Sequence:
- click "Insert table"
- window pops up like the "insert link" window
- the first screen of the window ask how large you would like the table (rows x columns) and whether or not you would like a header row
- the second screen of the window has the table laid out in HTML, with a text field in each cell for the user to fill in (header row is a header row if they selected a header row)
- click 'insert' and the table is inserted into the page!
fields.summary: Insert table wizard
